channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Family of victim shocked by stabbing, appeals for witnesses
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The family of the man who was fatally stabbed on Sunday night in Punggol Field arrived too late to catch his last words in hospital.

item.title: New daily high of 626 Covid-19 patients discharged
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of Covid-19 patients discharged from hospitals or community isolation facilities hit a new daily high of 626 yesterday.

item.title: SAF suspends all large-scale overseas exercises due to pandemic
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) has suspended all large-scale overseas exercises - including its biggest overseas, Exercise Wallaby held in Queensland, Australia - because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Labs to get advisories on steps to follow in testing
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

All laboratories conducting coronavirus tests will be issued advisories detailing the processes they should follow, said the Health Ministry's director of medical services Kenneth Mak yesterday.

item.title: Watchdog studying retail lease market amid complaints
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The Competition and Consumer Commission of Singapore (CCCS) is looking into the private retail lease market, amid a chorus of complaints by mall tenants of an imbalance of bargaining power with landlords and unfair clauses in tenancy agreements.

item.title: Reopening of the economy will be gradual and phased
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The reopening of Singapore's economy will happen in phases after the end of the circuit breaker period on June 1, with the Government monitoring the number of new Covid-19 cases each time to decide how soon even more restrictions can be lifted.

item.title: Millionaire couple donate 1,000 meals to the needy
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Millionaire venture capitalist Ozi Amanat and his wife Asema Ahmed have donated 1,000 meals to migrant workers in quarantine through the charity Free Food For All.

item.title: All foreign workers in dorms to be tested for Covid-19
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

All 323,000 foreign workers staying in dormitories will be tested for Covid-19 to ensure they are free of the virus before they resume work in the community and return to their dorms, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Indian eatery delivers free hot treats to healthcare staff
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Restaurant operations director Raghavendra Shastry was set on volunteering as a safe distancing ambassador to help in Singapore's Covid-19 fight.

item.title: Singapore diversifying sources of test kits and testing resources
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is diversifying its sources of Covid-19 testing resources even as it increases the rate of testing here, said the Ministry of Health's director of medical services Kenneth Mak yesterday.

item.title: Migrant workers get 'cool' gift packs
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singapore passed the one-month mark in the circuit breaker period, furniture and electronics giant Harvey Norman showed its appreciation towards migrant workers by giving them 1,162 gift packs.

item.title: In Brief : Plans to cope with influx at community isolation sites
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Plans are in place to cope with an expected influx of patients at community isolation sites, said Brigadier-General Seet Uei Lim, Chief Guards Officer in the Singapore Armed Forces, yesterday.

item.title: Pump prices fall below $2 a litre
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Pump prices have tumbled for the second time in two weeks, taking a litre of petrol to below $2 for the first time in several years.

item.title: Why S'pore has not adopted herd immunity strategy to fight virus
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Achieving herd immunity to Covid-19 through natural infection in the population will lead to a higher number of deaths and infections and overwhelm Singapore's healthcare system, said the Health Ministry's (MOH) director of medical services Kenneth Mak.

item.title: Israel delivers care packages for healthcare workers
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

From Israel with love - that was the message the country's ambassador to Singapore, Mr Sagi Karni, hand-delivered yesterday in the form of 200 care packages for healthcare workers at Singapore General Hospital.

item.title: Singapore eyes cautious easing of curbs if new cases stay low
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's strict safe distancing measures have helped to reduce the number of coronavirus cases in the local community, and could be further eased if all goes well until June 1, said Health Minister Gan Kim Yong yesterday.

item.title: Allowing people to visit relatives after June 1 under cautious study
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

It is with great caution that the Government is studying whether to allow people to visit their relatives after June 1, when the circuit breaker measures are lifted.

item.title: Changi T4 to suspend ops from Saturday
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Changi Airport will suspend operations at Terminal 4 from Saturday, following a suspension of services at Terminal 2 on May 1.

item.title: 20,000 migrant workers to recover and be discharged by end-May
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

By the end of the month, 20,000 migrant workers who were infected with Covid-19 will be discharged from care facilities, and more are expected to recover in June, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Reflections on attitudes towards migrant workers
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

There have been calls, on the one hand, for an apology from the Government.

item.title: Hair salons, TCM halls do brisk business as they reopen
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Business was brisk at hairdressing salons and barber shops yesterday morning as customers queued - keeping to social distancing - to crop their overgrown manes after the three-week shutdown of these premises.

item.title: Veggies to be grown at more HDB carpark rooftops
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

The rooftops of nine multi-storey carparks in Singapore will be converted for use to farm vegetables and other food crops later this year.

item.title: Home-based bakery's items snapped up amid rush for sweet treats
item.description:
May 13, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Rebecca Yong set an alarm for 8pm on Monday to remind herself to be at her laptop - to buy cookies and brownies.

item.title: 9 suspects arrested for rioting at Chinatown apartment block following police manhunt over three days
item.description:
May 13, 2020 2:07 AM

Police had earlier arrested three persons at the riot scene on Sunday.
